latest news.eng_title: Japan Condemns China's Incursion into Its Airspace as 'Grave Violation of Sovereignty'
latest news.summary: Japan has condemned China's incursion into its airspace as a 'grave violation of sovereignty'. According to a Japanese government spokesperson, Yoshimasa Hayashi, 'The violation of our airspace by a Chinese military plane is not only a grave violation of our sovereignty, but also a threat to our security and is totally unacceptable.' Japan has deployed fighter jets after a Chinese surveillance plane, a Y-9, entered Japanese airspace near the Danjo islands in Nagasaki prefecture for two minutes on Monday. Hayashi stated that 'We understand that this is the first confirmed and announced incursion of a Chinese military plane since we began taking measures against airspace incursions.' China has responded by saying it is 'verifying' whether one of its military planes violated Japanese airspace. 'The relevant Chinese authorities are investigating and verifying,' said Lin Jian, a Chinese diplomatic spokesperson. 'Both sides maintain communication through existing working channels. I would also like to emphasize that China has no intention of invading the airspace of any country,' he added.
latest news.title: Japón califica la incursión aérea china como «grave violación de soberanía»

latest news.eng_title: China Denies Intention to Invade Japan's Airspace After Incident
latest news.summary: China has denied any intention to invade Japan's airspace after a Chinese military aircraft briefly entered Japanese airspace over the Danjo Islands. According to Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Lin Jian, 'China is not intending to invade the airspace of any country.' Lin added that China and Japan 'maintain communication through existing working channels' to manage such situations. Japan has expressed concerns over the incident, with the country's Defense Ministry stating that the Chinese aircraft remained in Japanese airspace for two minutes. The Japanese government has also summoned the Chinese ambassador to Tokyo, presenting a 'very serious protest' and demanding measures to prevent future incidents. China's increasing military assertiveness in the region has raised concerns about security in the area.
latest news.title: China niega intención de invadir espacio aéreo japonés tras incidente con aeronave militar – El Nuevo Diario (República Dominicana)

latest news.eng_title: China Denies Deliberately Violating Japan's Airspace
latest news.summary: China has denied intentionally violating Japan's airspace after a Chinese military plane entered Japanese airspace over the Danjo islands in Nagasaki Prefecture on Monday. According to China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian, 'China has no intention of violating the airspace of any other country.' However, Lin did not confirm whether the airspace violation actually occurred, stating that relevant Chinese authorities are working to confirm the circumstances. Japan's Defense Ministry has confirmed that it was the first time a Chinese military plane has violated Japanese airspace. The incident has sparked alarm on the Japanese side over the purpose of the airspace violation.
latest news.title: China Denies Deliberately Violating Japan's Airspace

latest news.eng_title: Japan criticises ‘unacceptable' airspace violation by Chinese military plane
latest news.summary: A Chinese military plane briefly entered Japanese airspace on Monday, prompting the Japanese military to scramble fighter jets. Japanese chief cabinet secretary Yoshimasa Hayashi called the incident an 'absolutely unacceptable' territorial violation and safety threat. He said, 'The Chinese military aircraft's incursion into Japan's airspace not only is a serious violation of our territorial rights but also a safety threat. We found it absolutely unacceptable.' This is the first time a Chinese military aircraft has been detected in Japanese airspace. Japan has scrambled jets nearly 669 times between April 2023 and March 2024, with about 70% of those incidents involving Chinese military aircraft. Japanese defence officials are concerned about growing military co-operation between China and Russia, as well as China's increasingly assertive activity around Japanese waters and airspace. Tokyo has reinforced defences in south-western Japan, including remote islands that are key to Japan's defence strategy in the region.
latest news.title: Japan criticises ‘unacceptable' airspace violation by Chinese military plane

latest news.eng_title: 'Serious Violation': What Japan Said After Chinese Military Plane Violates Its Airspace
latest news.summary: A Chinese Y-9 reconnaissance plane briefly entered Japan's southwestern airspace on Monday, forcing the Japanese military to scramble fighter jets. Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshimasa Hayashi called the incident an 'absolutely unacceptable' territorial violation and safety threat, saying 'The Chinese military aircraft's incursion into Japan's airspace not only is a serious violation of our territorial rights but also a safety threat.' Japan has been increasingly concerned about China's military activity around its waters and airspace, and has reinforced defenses in the region. Japanese Vice Foreign Minister Masataka Okano summoned the acting Chinese Ambassador to strongly protest the airspace violation and demand that China take steps to avoid such incidents.
latest news.title: 'Serious Violation': What Japan Said After Chinese Military Plane Violates Its Airspace

latest news.eng_title: Chinese Military Aircraft Enters Japanese Airspace
latest news.summary: A Chinese military aircraft, a Y-9 intelligence gathering plane, entered Japanese airspace over the country's territorial waters near the Oshima Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture on August 26, 2024, according to a statement from the Japanese Ministry of Defense. The statement said, 'It was confirmed that a Chinese military aircraft had violated Japanese airspace between 11:29 and 11:31 on August 26, 2024.' In response, the Self-Defense Forces launched fighter jets from the Western Air Defense Force, took other measures, including issuing notifications and warnings, as stated in the statement.
latest news.title: Havada kırmızı alarm! Çin'e ait askeri uçak, Japonya hava sahasına girdi

latest news.eng_title: Chinese Y-9 Intelligence-Gathering Aircraft Violates Japan's Territorial Airspace
latest news.summary: A Chinese Y-9 intelligence-gathering aircraft violated Japan's territorial airspace off the Danjo Islands in Goto, Nagasaki Prefecture on August 26. The incident was the first confirmed intrusion into Japanese airspace by a Chinese military aircraft. 'There is no doubt that a military aircraft violating territorial airspace sends a very strong message,' a senior official of the Self-Defense Forces said. The Japanese government has lodged a protest with China over the violation, which prompted the SDF to scramble fighter jets. Some officials suspect the Chinese plane 'simply took a wrong course and entered Japan's territorial airspace,' while others believe it was a deliberate act of intelligence gathering. The plane was likely collecting information on two Air SDF monitoring radar facilities in the area. 'The aircraft that violated Japan's airspace this time has been gathering information on the SDF radar frequencies,' the ministry official said. 'It is natural to assume that the aircraft entered the airspace while concentrating on intelligence gathering.' The official said Japan must be vigilant about the fact that Chinese military aircraft are conducting intelligence gathering activities so close to the airspace of the Japanese mainland. A senior SDF official was perplexed about the latest intrusion, saying 'I don't know why it happened at this time.' Some speculate that the move was Beijing's way of responding to an earlier incident in July, where a Japanese vessel sailed through Chinese territorial waters without permission. 'The Chinese side may have suspected that the Japanese side had other intentions,' a diplomatic source said. Bonji Ohara, a senior fellow at the Sasakawa Peace Foundation, said the reason for the latest airspace violation was not immediately known, but 'I do not see any merit for China to militarily intimidate Japan at this time.'
latest news.title: Chinese violation of airspace in Kyushu shocks, confuses Japan

latest news.eng_title: China Accused of Entering Japanese Airspace with Military Surveillance Plane
latest news.summary: Japan has accused a Chinese military surveillance plane of entering its airspace and has called it a 'serious infringement of Japan's sovereignty.' The incident occurred on Monday when the Chinese Y-9 plane entered Japanese airspace for two minutes from 11:29 local time. Japan sent fighter jets into the air in response. According to Japanese government spokesperson Yoshimasa Hayashi, 'This infringement of our airspace by the Chinese plane is not only a serious infringement of our sovereignty, but also a threat to our security, and it is totally unacceptable.' Japan has not commented on the intentions of the Chinese plane, but Hayashi noted that China's recent military activities near Japan have been increasing and becoming more active. The Chinese ambassador to Japan was summoned to the Japanese Foreign Ministry, where Japan lodged a 'strong protest' and urged China to take measures to prevent similar incidents in the future.
latest news.title: Hevder kinesisk militærfly krenket japansk luftrom

latest news.eng_title: Japan condemns Chinese aircraft violation of its airspace – DW
latest news.summary: Japan has condemned a 'serious violation of our sovereignty' after a Chinese military plane entered its airspace for two minutes, flying over the Danjo Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture. Japan's chief government spokesman Yoshimasa Hayashi described the incursion as 'utterly unacceptable' and 'a threat to Japan's security.' The Chinese Y-9 surveillance aircraft was scrambled by Japanese fighter jets, and Tokyo has summoned a Chinese diplomat in protest. Hayashi stated that the government continues to monitor increasing Chinese military activity near Japan and will be fully prepared for any future airspace violations. He added that recent Chinese military activities near Japan have a tendency to expand and become increasingly active. This is not the first time a Chinese aircraft has violated Japan's airspace, with a China State Oceanic Administration plane doing so in 2012 and a China Coast Guard drone breaching Japan's airspace in 2017.
latest news.title: Japan condemns Chinese aircraft violation of its airspace – DW

latest news.eng_title: Chinese military plane breaches Japan airspace in a first
latest news.summary: A Chinese military aircraft, a Y-9 intelligence-gathering plane, entered Japanese airspace for the first time yesterday, sparking concerns over Beijing's willingness to take a harder stance in territorial disputes. Japan's top government spokesman, Yoshimasa Hayashi, called the incursion 'unacceptable' and a 'threat to our security.' The plane spent two minutes in Japanese airspace near uninhabited islands off the south coast before heading back to China. Japan has summoned China's acting ambassador to protest the air incursion and called for steps to prevent a recurrence. This incident comes amid tensions between China and Japan over territory, trade, and detained citizens, as well as a recent report of a Japanese destroyer sailing into Chinese territorial waters. 'This is not just a serious violation of our territory but also a threat to our security,' Hayashi said.
latest news.title: Chinese military plane breaches Japan airspace in a first

news knowledge.eng_title: China Violates Japanese Airspace with Spy Plane, Japan Deploys Fighter Jets
news knowledge.summary: Japan deployed fighter jets after its airspace was violated by a Chinese spy plane, according to the Ministry of Defense. The aircraft was identified as a Y9, a military transport and intelligence-gathering plane used by the Chinese People's Liberation Army. The Chinese plane breached Japan's 'territorial airspace' exactly over the Danjo Islands, an uninhabited archipelago in the south of the country. The penetration into Japanese airspace lasted for at least 2 minutes at 11:29 a.m., according to information revealed by the Ministry. This is the first incursion by China into Japanese airspace, and investigations are ongoing to determine the purpose of the flight. A Ministry of Defense official told NHK, 'The Chinese army is increasing its military activities in the ocean, including the East China Sea.' Although 'it is not clear at this time' the reason for the Chinese violation, the official added, 'we will take all possible precautions and monitor the situation.' Japan's Air Self-Defense Forces were deployed through rapid takeoff maneuvers in response to the intrusion, but by the time the fighter jets were deployed, the Chinese spy plane was already far from Japanese airspace.
news knowledge.title: Japón despliega aviones de caza tras vulneración de su espacio aéreo por parte de China: "Carácter de emergencia"

news knowledge.eng_title: Japan Deploys Fighter Jets After Chinese Aircraft 'Violates' Its Airspace
news knowledge.summary: Japan has deployed fighter jets after a Chinese military aircraft 'violated' its airspace, according to the Ministry of Defense. The ministry confirmed that a Chinese 'Y-9 spy plane' entered Japan's territorial airspace near the Danjo Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture for approximately two minutes at 11:29 am. The incident marks the first time a Chinese military aircraft has entered Japanese airspace. The Ministry stated that measures were taken by the Japanese Self-Defense Forces, including issuing warnings to the aircraft, but no arms were used as an alert. After the airspace violation, Japanese Vice Foreign Minister Masataka Okano summoned the Chinese ambassador to Japan and lodged a formal protest, calling for measures to prevent a repeat of the incident. The Chinese diplomat responded that the matter would be reported to Beijing. This incident is the latest in a series of tensions between Japan and China, particularly over disputed territories such as the Senkaku Islands in the East China Sea. Japan has strengthened its security ties with the US and other countries in the region to counter China's growing influence.
news knowledge.title: Le Japon accuse la Chine d'avoir "violé" son espace aérien et déploie ses avions de chasse

news knowledge.eng_title: Japan deploys fighter jets after Chinese aircraft violates airspace
news knowledge.summary: Japan deployed fighter jets on Monday after a Chinese military aircraft, a Y-9 intelligence-gathering plane, briefly entered Japanese airspace near the Danjo Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture. According to the Defense Ministry in Tokyo, the incident occurred between 11:29 a.m. and 11:31 a.m. This is the first publicly acknowledged violation of Japan's territorial airspace by China. Experts believe that these incursions are intended to assess Japan's response times and strain the capabilities of its fighter jet fleet. 'Although China regularly deploys aircraft into international airspace above the East China Sea, this incident represents a significant escalation,' said an expert. Japan's Air Self-Defense Forces dispatched fighter jets to intercept the aircraft and issue warnings. 'This is a clear challenge to Japan's sovereignty and a test of its military capabilities,' said another expert. The incident has raised concerns about the potential for further tensions between Japan and China.
news knowledge.title: Japan deploys fighter jets after Chinese aircraft violates airspace

news knowledge.eng_title: In a First, a Chinese Military Plane Breaches Japan's Territorial Airspace
news knowledge.summary: A Chinese military surveillance plane briefly entered Japanese airspace near Nagasaki Prefecture on Monday, marking the first known incursion by China's military into Japan's territorial airspace. According to Japan's defense ministry, the plane was spotted around 11:30 a.m. and was met with a warning from Japan's Self-Defense Force. Military analysts suggest that the airspace violation could be a message from China challenging Japan's delineation of its territorial border. This incident is the latest in a series of recent events heightening tensions between Japan and China, including a Chinese newscaster asserting that the Senkaku Islands are Chinese territory and graffiti at the Yasukuni Shrine war-commemoration site using Chinese characters that read 'toilet.' Japanese officials summoned Chinese Embassy representatives to a meeting on Monday evening and urged them to prevent future incursions into Japanese airspace.
news knowledge.title: In a First, a Chinese Military Plane Breaches Japan's Territorial Airspace

news knowledge.eng_title: China's Military Plane Violates Japan's Airspace, Sparking Tensions
news knowledge.summary: Japan's Defense Ministry reported that a Chinese military plane 'violated Japan's territorial airspace in front of the Danjo Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture.' The ministry stated that it mobilized its 'fighter jets on an emergency basis' after the Chinese plane, a 'Y-9 information-gathering aircraft,' entered Japanese airspace at 11:29 (2:29 GMT) for approximately two minutes. This is reportedly the first time a Chinese military plane has entered Japanese airspace. The incident comes amid tensions between China and Japan over disputed territories, particularly the Senkaku Islands in the East China Sea, which China claims as the Diaoyus. Japan's Defense Ministry emphasized that it will continue to monitor the situation and take necessary measures to protect its airspace. 'We will take all necessary measures to ensure the safety of our airspace,' said the ministry in a statement.
news knowledge.title: Japón denuncia violación de espacio aéreo por avión chino – DW

news knowledge.eng_title: China's Plane Violates Japan's Airspace for First Time
news knowledge.summary: Japanese Defense Forces scrambled fighter jets in response to a Chinese Y-9 reconnaissance plane violating Japan's airspace. According to the Japanese Ministry of Defense, the incident occurred in the Dandzō islands area (Nagasaki Prefecture) at 11:29 local time (05:29 MSK). The Chinese plane was in Japanese airspace for approximately two minutes. This is the first time a Chinese plane has violated Japan's airspace. Japanese Foreign Ministry's Deputy Minister Masataka Okano summoned China's Charge d'Affaires Shi Eiya to express a protest and demand measures to prevent similar incidents. Relations between China and Japan are at a critical point, with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi stating in July that 'either we move forward or we fall behind' to Japanese Foreign Minister Yoko Kamikawa. Tensions between the two countries have been exacerbated by territorial disputes in the East China Sea, particularly over the Senkaku Islands (known as Diaoyu in China), as well as China's dissatisfaction with Japan's decision to allow the discharge of treated water from the damaged Fukushima nuclear power plant into the sea.
news knowledge.title: Китайский самолет впервые нарушил воздушное пространство Японии

news knowledge.eng_title: Japan Deploys Fighter Jets After Chinese Plane Violates Airspace
news knowledge.summary: Japan deployed fighter jets on Monday after a Chinese military plane violated Japanese airspace, according to the Ministry of Defense. The Chinese plane, a 'Y-9 information-gathering aircraft', entered Japanese airspace at 11:29 (02:29 GMT) for about two minutes, the ministry stated. This is reportedly the first time a Chinese military plane has entered Japanese airspace. The incident comes amid tensions between China and Japan over disputed islands in the East China Sea, known as the Senkaku Islands by Japan and the Diaoyu Islands by China. 'A Chinese plane has violated the territorial airspace in front of the Danjo Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture,' the ministry said in a statement, adding that it had mobilized its 'fighter jets on an emergency basis.'
news knowledge.title: Japón despliega cazas tras violación de su espacio aéreo por un avión chino

news knowledge.eng_title: Japan Mobilizes Fighter Jets After Chinese Plane Violates Airspace
news knowledge.summary: Japan mobilized fighter jets on Monday after a Chinese military aircraft violated Japanese airspace, according to the Ministry of Defense. A Chinese plane 'violated Japan's territorial airspace over the Danjo Islands, Nagasaki Prefecture,' states a statement released by the ministry, which also announces the mobilization of 'fighter jets on an emergency basis.'
news knowledge.title: Japão mobiliza caças após violação de seu espaço aéreo por avião chinês

news knowledge.eng_title: In first, Japan says Chinese military aircraft violated territorial airspace
news knowledge.summary: For the first time, Japan has confirmed that a Chinese military aircraft violated its territorial airspace on Monday morning. According to the Defense Ministry in Tokyo, a Chinese Y-9 intelligence-gathering plane briefly entered Japanese territory near the Danjo Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture from 11:29 a.m. to 11:31 a.m. The Air Self-Defense Forces scrambled fighter jets to notify and warn the intruding aircraft. Observers say this move is intended to test Japan's response time and erode the capabilities of its fighter jets. 'This is a significant development,' said a defense expert, 'as it shows China's increasing assertiveness in the region.'
news knowledge.title: In first, Japan says Chinese military aircraft violated territorial airspace

news knowledge.eng_title: Japan Deploys Fighter Jets After Chinese Spy Plane Violates Airspace
news knowledge.summary: Japan deployed fighter jets on Monday after a Chinese military intelligence plane violated Japanese airspace, marking the first such incursion by a Chinese aircraft in the archipelago. According to the Ministry of Defense, a Chinese plane 'has violated the territorial airspace in front of the Danjo Islands', a small uninhabited archipelago off the coast of Nagasaki Prefecture (southwest of the country). The Ministry added that it had mobilized its 'fighter jets on an emergency basis'. The aircraft was identified as a Y9 spy plane. The incident is ongoing...
news knowledge.title: Japón desplegó cazas para responder a la violación de su espacio aéreo por parte de un avión espía chino Infobae
